title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 375-6.4 - Restricted use soil cleanup objectives for the protection of public health
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 375-6.4 - Restricted use soil cleanup objectives for the protection of public health

State Regulations
(a) Applicability. A protection of public health soil cleanup objective is applicable for the
protection of public health at every restricted use site where contamination
has been identified in soil above the residential use soil cleanup objectives
for a compound included in Table 375-6.8(b) of this Subpart, and the department
has determined that remediation is required to protect public health. (b) Soil cleanup objectives. Protection of
public health soil cleanup objectives have been developed for: (1)

Residential use, as set forth in section
375-1.8
(g)(2)(i)
of this Part. The residential use soil cleanup objectives are presented in the
protection of public health-residential use column of Table 375-6.8(b) of this

Subpart. (2)

Restricted-residential
use, as set forth in section
375-1.8
(g)(2)(ii)
of this Part. The restricted- residential use soil cleanup objectives are
presented in the protection of public health, restricted-residential use column
of Table 375-6.8(b) of this Subpart. (3)

Commercial use, as set forth in section
375-1.8
(g)(2)(iii)
of this Part. The commercial use soil cleanup objectives are presented in the
protection of public health-commercial use column of Table 375-6.8(b) of this

Subpart. (4)

Industrial use, as set
forth in section
375-1.8
(g)(2)(iv)
of this Subpart. The industrial use soil cleanup objectives are presented in
the protection of public health-industrial use column of Table 375-6.8(b) of
this Subpart. (c) Selection of the restricted use soil cleanup objectives. In addition to the
protection of public health soil cleanup objective for the identified use of
the site, protection of groundwater and ecological resources soil cleanup
objectives shall be considered where applicable. The contaminant-specific soil
cleanup objectives for the soil cleanup component of the remedial program shall
be the lowest of the applicable contaminant-specific soil cleanup objectives
which are identified for the site as set forth in paragraphs (1) through (3) of
this subdivision. (1)

The protection of
groundwater soil cleanup objectives in Table 375-6.8(b) of this Subpart will be
applicable to the site and evaluated in determining the soil cleanup objectives
for a site as set forth in section
375-6.5
of this Subpart. (2)

The protection of ecological resources
soil cleanup objectives in Table 375-6.8(b) of this Subpart will be applicable
to the site and evaluated in determining the soil cleanup objectives in section
375-6.6
of this Subpart. (3)

The protection of public health soil
cleanup objective for the current, intended and reasonably anticipated future
use of the site in Table 375-6.8(b) of this Subpart, will be applicable and
evaluated in determining the soil cleanup objectives for every site, unless a
site-specific soil cleanup objective is proposed. Notes
